passages.name: Start
after_First
after_First1
passages.text:
"..."
"Tammi, you're a complete mess. It's summer vacation, and we just finished the first year of college. You just finished taking summer classes. This should be a time for you to relax," Kaylee soothingly tried to calm you down. You know she wasn't lecturing you. In fact, you knew she was trying to cheer you up, but it was not working.
"I know," you mumbled between hiccups. "It's just that I love him." Although you cannot see her face, you can imagine Kaylee's eyes either rolling or widening. You knew she wasn't too fond of your boyfriend since he visited the room too many times to count, but right now you are focusing on your feelings.
"I know it hasn't been a year yet," you continue, "but he's my first boyfriend and guy friend. It hurts." Your voice gets louder and deeper, and you are breathing in too hard that you can feel the air drowning your throat.
As you begin to shake, you feel smooth, large hands rubbing your back. You want to let it all out, but you did not want to wake Kaylee's father up, so you cover your mouth with your hands until you calmed down a bit. You felt guilty that your new best friend had to comfort you despite it being super early in the morning so you faked a smile and sent her away.
[[Continue|after_First2]]

passages.name: after_First2
after_First3
Flashback1
passages.text:
''Flashback''
You came back to your dorm all sweaty with your ponytail barely in tact with your roommate Kaylee from ballroom dance practice. Both of you have not tried ballroom dancing before, but after tonight, you both don't believe you will continue with it. 
When you came back, you saw an extra person in the room. Your other friend Hanna invited her high school friend from another college to visit, but that wasn't the extra person. 
You see a dorky-looking man with a loose purple T-shirt with from a hack-a-thon. He was on his computer exchanging friend IDs with your other friend Camilla. Deciding that you want to make friends during your first year of college, you push away any remaining shyness and sit down with the group to introduce yourself.
[[Continue|after_Flashback1]]

passages.name: after_First4
passages.text:
//Ah, I shouldn't think about it. I might cry even more, if that's possible. I should just go on my phone.//

[[Continue|Same_room_after_toilet_pt3]]

passages.name: after_Flashback1
passages.text:
"Hi, my name is Tammi. What's your name?" You bring out your hand to shake like you have done with every new student you have met.
"Hey, I'm James." He shook your hand in response and you notice that his hands are large, but then again, you are petite for your age, so it might be that every hand except a child's will seem big to you.
"What year are you in?" You learned that asking questions will keep the conversation flowing. At least, that's what you observed in the first week of college.
"First. You?"
"Same! What classes are you taking?"
"Single-variable Calculus, Accelerated Programming, History of the Pacific Islanders, and Accelerated Writing."
"Oh! I'm in Accelerated Writing, too."
"Yeah, but he has it in a different time," Camilla, your cosplaying friend who is also in the same writing class as you.
After talking a bit more, you find out that he is Hanna's visiting friend's high school friend.
//So he's Cooper's friend. Cooper is way cuter.//
[[Continue|after_Flashback1-Reality]]

passages.name: after_Flashback1-Reality
after_Flashback1-Reality1
passages.text:
Attempting to switch sides once more, you are now facing the door. The lights are still off, but the light of the moon illuminates inside the room giving the faint figure of the door in front of you. You notice that the door wasn't shut all the way because you can see a border of yellow light illuminating the door's edge. 
//Kaylee probably forgot to close it all the way.//
You want to close it to be in complete darkness again, but you feel powerless. You feel useless, as if some evil demon extracted all of the living soul of your body.

[[Keep staring at the door|Door]]
[[Switch positions|switch_pos]]

passages.name: Door
passages.text:
"Graaghh!" you softly yell to yourself while attempting to get up. After several attempts, you finally are able to sit upright on your knees. 
//Hah, hah, hah//
Breathing heavily, your chest starts to hurt once more. Before you get up, you pause, waiting for your heartbeat to slow down. Your vision is still blurry, and the puffiness has obscured a part of your vision. At least you can point out the light from the hallway. You blink and remove your long strands of hair out of your face. You grab your weight and scootch towards the end of the cold bed. You are an inch away from the edge of the bed and look down at the dark floor. When you first arrived at the house, you were nervous because you found so many lizards and cockroaches roaming around. Ever since you found a cockroach in the bathroom sink while getting ready to brush your teeth, you have been cautious. Staring at the floor, you dangle your feet getting ready to finally get up.
[[Continue|closed_Door]]

passages.name: switch_pos
passages.text:
You switch positions, but after two minutes, you get frustrated.

[[Continue|Door]]

passages.name: closed_Door
passages.text:
Gulping in air and sniffing in one big sniffle, you slowly place your feet on the cold wooden floor. You feel the tingling sensation taking over the soles of your feet. Standing up straight, you feel your legs wobbling and try to balance yourself but no use. You fall towards the edge of the bed by quickly twisting your body away from the door. Sucking in your breath once more, you bend your arms as if you are doing a push-up and wilth all the force left in your body, you spring up, only to lose your balance once again. Thankfully, you catch your self before hitting the ground and hold in your breath. You can feel your heartbeat increasing once again but you try to ignore it in order to keep going. You bend down to take a breather and close your eyes for a second to calm yourself. You lift your face to see the yellow light shining on the door knob.
You're almost there.
[[Continue|closed_Door_Part2]]

passages.name: closed_Door_Part2
passages.text:
As you drag your feet against the cold floor, you see the light getting taking up more of your vision. 
//Almost there//
Once you are at arms length with the door, you stare at the knob. Your initial goal was to just close the door all the way, but now you are having second thoughts.
//Should I sleep in the other room with Kaylee so she won't worry or should I continue to sleep here?//
You were supposed to be sleeping in the same room with your best friend, but when you found out that no one is using the room you are in right now, you have been using it to cry and talk to your boyfriend whenever he contacts you.
[[Sleep in the other room|other_Room]]
[[Just close the door|stay_In_the_Room]]

passages.name: other_Room

links.text: No. You might end up making more noise than you should.
Yes. You might end up crashing into something when going to the bed and wake up Kaylee.

passages.name: stay_In_the_Room
passages.text:
You did not want to risk having another crying fit and waking up Kaylee. When you first slept in the same room as your roommates, you remember that she did not handle mornings well.
You silently and quickly shut the door before you change your mind. You go back to the bed with the last remaining strength remaining and face the ceiling. Your arm is pressed down on your forehead to massage your painful migraine, and you notice your forehead is burning.
//I hope I don't have a fever.//
You feel your eyes tiring out from all the work it took to shut the door.
//That's good. I might be able to sleep tonight.//
You close your eyes, taking in the entire darkness while gripping on your cell phone.
[[Continue|Flashback_First_Anime]]

passages.name: Credits
passages.text:
''Back Then''
							 By Janelynn Camingue
							 Created on 3/25/2017
							 
							 
							 
							 
							 
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
						
[[Start|Start]]

passages.name: Flashback_Num_2
passages.text:
''Flashback''
"Guys, I can't believe we actually woke up at 6 A.M. just to get breakfast," you sleepily remark your roommates as you unlock the door to get back in your room.
"Hey, it was free. Plus, they were fresh unlike in the dining hall," Kaylee replied, also in a tired voice.
"I just can't believe //you// got up," Mandy, your other roommate, surprisingly said to Kaylee.
"Yeah, that's true," you slightly teased your best friend with a sloppy-looking smug look on your face.
"Shut up" Kaylee jokingly replied as she climbed the bunk bed's ladder to go back to her bed. "I'm gonna go back to sleep."
"Same."
"You guys are weak," Mandy laughingly said.
[[Continue|Flashback_Num_2-1]]

passages.name: Flashback_Num_2-1
passages.text:
Facing the wall slowly waking up from your nap, you can hear two familiar voices in the room. One male and one female. 
//James and Camilla? What are they doing here?//
You are too lazy to flip sides, so you just continue to listen.

"So then he grabbed me and we just started making out and-" Camilla was cut off by another female voice, presumably Kaylee.
"Camilla!"
"Shhhh! Tammi is sleeping." Camilla whispered.
//Alright, I guess that's my queue?// 
"No, I'm awake now." You turn over facing them and sit up, covering your body with the blanket to keep its warmth.
//I hope I didn't do anything while I was sleeping.//
"Good morning!" everyone cheers to you. 
"Morning. I didn't do anything weird while I was sleeping, right." The room was silent.
"Guys!" Your face becomes hotter than the warmth that the blanket gave you as you hide your face in your pillow.
[[Continue|Flashback_Num_2-2]]

passages.name: Flashback_First_Anime
passages.text:
''Flashback''
"Oh, where are we sitting?" you ask Kaylee as you follow her to eat lunch in the dining hall.
"Cooper and James are here, so we're sitting with them."
"Mmkay."
When you find the table, you see Hanna sitting with the two men.
//Oh, right. Kaylee and Hanna have a club meeting right after lunch. Will I be okay by myself with these two?//
You are used to hanging out with females since all of your friends in high school were females. 
//Yeah, you'll be okay. Don't worry.//
You wave off any worries and continue to smile and greet Cooper and James as you sit down to eat your pasta. 
You cautiously eat your pasta since you are usually messy whenever you eat food with sauce. 
//I don't want to embarrass myself.//
You silently eat your food as you mind your own business as Kaylee and Hanna quickly chow down their food to go to their meeting.
[[Continue|Flashback_First_Anime1]]

passages.name: Flashback_First_Anime1
passages.text:
"See ya!" Hanna and Kaylee scooted their chairs in to bus their dishes to leave for the meeting.
//Now what? Should I say something?//
You start to listen to the conversation that Cooper and James are having.
"So what do you want to do today?" James asked Cooper as if he was a tour guide. 
"Do you know any trails?"
"Trails? Yeah. Never took you as the nature type, though"
"Hey, I like exploring, thank you very much."
"Other than being cooped up in a room on the computer?"
"Whatever, James. So do you know any trails or not?"
"Sorry, sorry," James held up his hands in defense. "Yeah, I know some trails. We can go after lunch." Turning towards you, he asked, "Do you want to go see some trails?"
"Sure!" You smile for the invite.
[[Continue|Flashback_First_Anime2]]

passages.name: Flashback_First_Anime2
Flashback_First_Anime3
passages.text:
You stare intently at his back to think of a topic to talk about.
//Should I ask the basic questions like why he decided to major in Computer Science? Or should I go for something like how did he find this trail? Nah, that'll make me seem like I don't go out a lot.//
Not being able to come up with anything, you decide to stay quiet and notice a familiar building.
"Oh, this is our dorm!" you surprisingly remark as you come out of the forest.
"Yeah, it's a pretty nice path if you want to avoid the cars when coming back from the dining hall." James neutrally replied.
"I see."
Once you and the two guys reached the door, you let James unlock the door to go to your room since yours was bigger and had more room.
[[Continue|Flashback_First_Anime_END]]

passages.name: Flashback_First_Anime_END
passages.text:
As you finish remembering that small memory, you slowly stir. Too scared that if you open your eyes all the way that you might not be able to sleep again, you open them just a little to see the time. The room is still dark, but looking outside the window made it seem like maybe one or two hours have passed. The country you are in is always hot, so even when it is early in the morning, there is a significant amount of light. 
Reaching for your phone, you press the power button with your thumb. Your hand is too weak, so you have to press the phone against your bottom hip as support.
Once you succeeded in turning the screen on, you look down to see a burst of blue light.
//Ah, so bright.//
"It's only 4? Did I really only sleep for an hour?"
You flip your phone upside down to hide the bright light sigh.
//I really want to sleep.//
[[Continue|After_Second_flashback]]

passages.name: After_Second_flashback
After_Second_Flashback_part2

links.text: Head back to Kaylee's room. Maybe you'll get enough sleep?
Head back to the same room. I don't want to disturb her.

passages.name: Kaylee_room_after_toilet
Same_room_after_toilet
Same_room_after_toilet_pt2
Same_room_after_toilet_pt3
passages.text:
You turn on your phone and switch your sleeping position to the side facing the outlet since your USB chord is short.
//What should I look up?//
[[Facebook|Facebook_App]]
[[One of your dating sims applications|Dating_Sim]]
[[Check your summer grades|Summer_Grades]]

links.text: One of your dating sims applications

passages.name: Facebook_App
passages.text:
"I wonder what's been going on at home?" You were curious and opened the Facebook application. Scrolling through the newsfeed, you find uninteresting posts. All of a sudden, you remember that you need to post the recent pictures you took and add them to your vacation album. You check all the photos you want to upload.
"120 pictures. Not bad."
As you wait for the photos to finish uploading, you scroll even further down the newsfeed to see if anything has been going on with you-know-who.
"Nothing."

[[Continue|AfterFacebookScrolling]]

passages.name: Dating_Sim
passages.text:
"Ah, I haven't caught up with my stories. I bought so many at the sale last month, but I haven't even touched any."
You used to be obsessed with dating sims in high school, but your obsession died down ever since you got your first boyfriend. "I remember always envying the main character for experiencing love and some hot shot falling for her."
You start to reminisce about those days, but your mood starts to sour quickly.
"All of the content in these games are fictional, that I can say for sure."
As your words turn bitter, you shake your head and try to think happy thoughts.
"So who should I romance this time? Let's see..." You browse all of the stories that you have purchased and not played yet. "Okay, I have a prince, math teacher, and a journalist."

[[Continue|DatingSimRoute]]

passages.name: Summer_Grades
Stay_In_Kaylee_Room
passages.text: Double-click this passage to edit it.

passages.name: Go_Bck_Get_Phone

links.text: On second thought, you don't need your phone.

passages.name: Check_phone_for_message
passages.text:
//If I don't check it, this will bug me the rest of the night. Or should I say morning? Whatever.//
You reach for your phone at the end of the bed and press the power button to get to the lockscreen. 
Although you are only on the lockscreen, you can see the short message on the top of the screen.
''You awake?''

You feel a mix of emotions as you try to take in the two words. You feel a mix of butterflies and a hole growing in your heart.
//Should I reply?//

[[Reply. You might not get another chance until tomorrow morning.|Reply]]
[[Don't reply. You might end up not sleeping at all.|Don't_reply]]

links.text: Reply. You might not get another chance until tomorrow morning.
Don't reply. You might end up not sleeping at all.

passages.name: back_to_kayleeRoom
passages.text:
You see Kaylee still sleeping as you go back on the bed. Gently, you put the covers over your head. Although it is extremely hot where you are vacationing, you have a feeling that it will get cold at night. 
You close your eyes tight and try to fall asleep. After all of the energy you used up, you find yourself accomplishing the task.

[[Continue|Flashback_Num_2]]

passages.name: Reply
passages.text:
//I should keep this short.//
''Yes.'' you reply. You notice his icon fell next to you message meaning that it ha been read. After a second or two, you see the three dots, indicating that he is typing something.
Your heart races, wondering what he is typing.
//No, no, no. Don't get excited.//
You scold your feelings as you wait for him to reply.
''Do you want to video chat?'' he finally typed.
[[Let's stick to messaging.|Stick-to-messaging]]
[[Sure.|Answer_Phone]]

passages.name: Don't_reply
Stick-to-messaging
passages.text:
''No. Let's stick to messaging.'' you coldly reply.
''Ok.''
You wait for him to type something. 
''How's the trip?''
//Should I stick with one-worded answers to show my uneasiness? Nah, that sounds too weird.//
''It's fine. How's work?''
He finally got hired at our school as a waiter for special events, so he moved in back to school early.
''Pretty good. Nice people. The campus is so quiet for once, though.''
//Nice people?// Your face twists into a scowl.
//Like who? As in ''females?''//
Your eyebrows burrow in jealousy and confusion. Maybe even some anger. 
''Oh. I see. That's good.'' you manage to type in a simple response.
//This is eating me up. Why am I so jealous?//
You were never jealous before until //that// happened. What he did to you destroyed your self of steem so much that all you can feel is jealousy and insecurity.
[[Continue|Wait_for_message]]

passages.name: Wait_for_message
passages.text:
''I'm trying to make more guy friends.''
//How did he know?// You were slightly surprised that he had a feeling you were feeling uncomfortable with his message.
''I guess you're still a mindreader, huh?''
''No. i just had a feeling. You know I'm not a mindreader.''
''Well, you always seem like you are one.''
''It's just that you're easy to read.''
//I really want to sass him right now.//
How should you respond?

[[''If I'm so easy to read, how is it that I'm in this mess in the first place?''|Sass1]]

[[''So what do you think I'm feeling now, then?''|Sass2]]

links.text: ''If I'm so easy to read, how is it that I'm in this mess in the first place?''
''So what do you think I'm feeling now, then?''

passages.name: Sass1
Sass2
passages.text:
''So what do you think I'm feeling now, then?''
Immediately, you regret the message. 
//Okay, maybe that was a bit harsh.//
You are about to type a different message when you receive another message.
''I know, and I'm sorry.''
"Hah. He says sorry too much."
''You say sorry a lot, you know that?'' You irritatingly reply.
''I know. It's just, I don't know what else to say.'' Your eyebrows furrow at the response.
//What? What did he just reply to me?// You start to get angry until the phone rings.

[[Continue|Answer_Phone]]

passages.name: Answer_Phone
passages.text:
You find your index finger reaching for the green button on the screen to accept the call. You cannot find yourself stopping your actions.
//Beep//
"Hello?" You hear a manly voice and see the familiar black-rimmed glasses staring at you. You don't say anything and just stare. He waves his hands in front of what you suspect is his laptop. You blink once and respond in a faint and cracked voice.
"Hey."
"How is it there?" he gives a small smile.
"Hot. Hot and humid."
"Haha, I see. Having fun?"
//Fun is the last thing I'm having right now.//
"..."
You are too preoccupied in your thoughts to notice that his smile faded away.
"Hey, remember when I first confessed to you?"

[[Continue|Flashback3]]

passages.name: Flashback3
passages.text:
''Flashback''
"See you guys over break!" Kaylee, the last roommate left, called over her shoulder before the door shut closed as you and James were finishing up an anime he wanted to show you after finals.
"So, now what?" James asked you after finishing the episode. Both of your roommates had left for winter break after their finals, and it was just the both of you in a large dorm room at night. He paused the video since it was just the ending credits that was playing and looked at you in the eyes.
You glanced at him and evaded his eyes and suddenly the floor interested you.
"So, now that we're alone," you started, "who do you like?" 
//Omigosh, I cannot believe I just asked that!// Apparently, everyone knew who he liked except you, and you absolutely cannot get it out of your head. You remember when you, James, and Kaylee were going through Facebook profiles of Cooper's old crushes and then when Kaylee asked if James liked anyone, he was smiling and quiet, which caused the whole fiasco of you trying to find out who the person he liked was. You asked everyone, and he dropped subtle hints, but no one would tell you and you could not figure it out.
[[Continue|Flashback-pt1]]

passages.name: Flashback-pt1
passages.text:
After the random question, you look over your shoulder only to see his pale face turn cherry, and he is wearing a bashful smile.
"Uh..." He used his large hand to cover his mouth in embarrassment.
"Is she pretty? Oh, of course she is since you like her." You began to continue your talk from a few days ago. "Oh, is it Mandy? You guys both love gaming and stuff. Or is it Kaylee since she is more boyish? Is it Camilla because she cosplays?" You continue to bombard the poor guy with too many questions.
//I'm surprised he hasn't told me to shut or or something. Should I keep asking him?//
"Well, you know her." 
//Do I? I mean, I suspected myself, but I don't want to get too cocky. I mean, I like him, but what will it feel like if he says a different name?//
"I know her? Okay. Well, those are the only people we both know." You being to ponder like a detetive.
"Ah, I almost forgot! Is it Hanna? I know she went to your high school but you didn't know her until Cooper came over."
"No" he said firmly.
[[Continue|Flashback-pt2]]

passages.name: Flashback-pt2
passages.text:
"Then I don't know." You look up at him in a look of defeat. "I'm completely stumped.
James stares at you with a mysterious look. You look in each other's eyes, waiting for someone to talk first.
"Do you really want to know who I like?" he asked in a soft but smooth voice.
"Yes!" You half jokingly and half seriously answered. You giggle and smile at him with a childlish smile, waiting for him to continue.
"Okay." He went back to his computer and went on YouTube to play a rock song in another foreign language. Taking a deep breath, he faced you once more and spilled the beans.
"I like you." You faintly hear his voice over the loud music.
"You like me?" You had to clarify. You just had to before you can jump for joy.
He nodded. Your heartbeat increases in excitement as you breathe in through your nostrils.
//Well, here goes nothing.//

[[Continue|Flashback-pt3]]

passages.name: Flashback-pt3
passages.text:
You stare into his eyes, trying hard not to look away. 
"I like you, too." The four words barely escape your mouth as he takes you in a hug. It was sort of awkward but sweet nonetheless.

[[Continue|Flashback3Over]]

passages.name: Flashback3Over
passages.text:
"No, not that confession." James suspected you were remembering the "unofficial" confession. "I'm talking about the second time I confessed to you. The real one.
//Oh yeah.// 
He took back the first one because he said it was too early, but then a week later when you met up with him in his hometown, he confessed again, but this time, he asked you to be his girlfriend.
"How could I forget that one, too. Both of them are two of my favorite memories." You smile as tears roll down your cheeks. "I," you start to stumble over your words again, "I always thought that that was one of the reasons why last year was the best year of school in my life, but now, I'm not so sure that it should've happened in the first place." You start crying harder, but you cover your mouth with your hands to lessen the noise.

[[Continue|Crying_so_Much]]

passages.name: Crying_so_Much
passages.text:
//I trusted him. I believed in him.//
"I want to say I wish you never were so sweet to be since the beginning, but I can't bring myself to do it. I can't bring myself to let you go."
"I'm so sorry, Tammi. I'm so sorry I hurt you. I hate doing this over the phone, but we have no choice."
"I'm sorry, too. I'm sorry for not being who you wanted me to be. I'm sorry for not paying attention. I'm sorry for wasting the rest of our freshman year."
As you lose control of your emotions, you see the time posted on the top corner of your phone. 
"James, it's 6A.M. here, so it's like 9P.M. over there. Don't you have work tomorrow?" You feel your mouth shaking as you tell him. You don't want him to hang up, but he has work.
"I can stay up for another hour" he calmly said, giving you a teary-eyed smile.
"Ok."
[[Continue|Flashback_best_Confession]]

passages.name: Flashback_best_Confession
passages.text:
After an hour of having an awkward conversation about random things like your vacation and his job, he tells you goodnight and exits the video chat. 
//I should try to at the least take a nap.//
You close your eyes and think about the "official confession."

[[Continue|Official_Confession]]

passages.name: Official_Confession
passages.text:
''Flashback''

''I'm here.'' You look at your phone as you finish the doughnut you purchased at a cafe. It was a week after finals and you, James, Cooper, Kaylee, and Hanna planned to meet up in James, Cooper, and Hanna's hometown since they live in the largest city out of the group. James wanted to meet up with you while Cooper and Hanna planned to meet up with Kaylee, and then everyone would meet in the middle.
You throw your trash away and scan the sea of people to find James. 
''Okay,'' you type. ''I'm at one of the tables in front of the cafe.''
''Cafe?'' 
You begin to type more specific details until you got another notification.
''Oh. Found you.''
You brush your head up to scour the crowd once more only to see a man in a familiar blue sweater heading towards your table.

[[Continue|You_Made_it]]

passages.name: You_Made_it
passages.text:
"You made it. I'm glad." He pats your head like a puppy and both of you head out to meet the others.
"How've you been?" You strike up a conversation. 
"Pretty good. Did you eat already?"
"Only a small snack." You pass by a noodle shop and you stare at the display window full of what the restaraunt serves.
"Oh, I need to tie my shoe." You look down at his shoes in a confused way because his shoes are perfectly tied, but you don't say anything further.
//Maybe he meant he wanted to retie it.//
You go back to looking at the food and then back at James to find him on one knee as if he is proposing. 
//What is going on?// You start to blush and then look around to see if anyone is staring at the two of you. 
//Okay, good. No one is staring.//
You bring your full attention back to James and notice that he is holding a pink paper heart.
"Tammi, will you be my girlfriend?"

[[Continue|Flashback_part3_Confession_good]]

passages.name: Flashback_part3_Confession_good
passages.text:
You're speechless, and all you can do is nod excitedly. 
//I want to cry, and I never cry in romance movies. This is literally the best day ever.//
He smiles back at you giving half of a heart with the words ''Yes'' written on it. You open it and it is a note:

	//Tammi, if you said yes, then this piece is for you. I am so glad yu     said yes.I'm not good at these things because I have never been in a     relationship before, but I'll try my best to make you happy as a         friend and especially as a boyfriend. Your boyfriend. I just ask one     thing in return, which is being honest with me. I don't trust a lot       of people because of the fear of getting hurt, but if we be honest       with each other, I have a feeling this relationship will work. I have     your heart, and you have mine.
	
	Love,
		James//

Your smile brightens even more as you take in word for word. You look at James and give jump into his arms to give him a hug.

[[Continue|Awwww]]

passages.name: Awwww
passages.text:
You walk side by side in silence as you both smile bashfully.
"Can I..." James started, "Can I hold your hand?"
"Yes" you timidly reply. 
You give him your hand and you can feel his warmth as it wraps around your fingers.
"Your hand is so small!" James surprisingly remarked. You giggle cutely in response. "Hey, do you want to grab a quick snack before we meet up with them?"
"Sure. Lead the way."
"Will do."
He takes you on a little detour, and you find yourself in front of an oriental shop.


[[Continue|Shop]]

passages.name: Shop
passages.text:
You enter to the smell of cakes and sweets. You see that there are small cakes that are smaller than your hand.
"Wow!" You look at the cakes in awe. All of your friends knew you had a sweet tooth.
"Which one do you want?"
"Um, I want the Coco Chocolate Swirl."
"Alri-"
"ACTUALLY, I want the Vanilla Rainbow Heaven."
"Oka-"
"Oh! Actually nevermind. I want the Coco Chocolate Swirl. Final answer."
"Haha, alright. You're so cute." He softly stroked your head and proceeded to go to the cash register.
"Hello, there!" The cashier greeted James enthusiastically.
"Hi. Can I get one piece of the Coco Chocolate Swirl and one piece of the Vanilla Rainbow Heaven?"
"Coming right up!"

[[Continue|CakesNDStuff]]

passages.name: CakesNDStuff
passages.text:
//Did he actually want the Vanilla Rainbow Heaven?//
"That'll be eight dollars." You watch him pay because you had a feeling you would be slow in paying your share. 
//I'll pay him when we exit the shop.//
James gets the plastic bag full of treats and both of you head out the shop. You start to rummage through your miniature black purse and take our your wallet.
"Here's four dollars for the cake." You hand out the four dollar bill to James. 
"Keep it."
"Huh?"
"Think of this a date."
"But even if it's a date, I would like to pay for my own share."
"Well, how about a gift?"
You pout your lips and put your money back in your wallet.
"Alright. Thank you." He gives you your cake, and he gets his.
"Hey, James. Did you actually want the Vanilla Rainbow Heaven cake?"
"I mean, I've been to this shop a couple of times and never tasted this flavor, so I was going to get it eventually" he coolly responds.
"That doesn't really answer the question" you whine.
"Don't worry about it." He gently grabs your hand and you eat your cakes while waiting at the bus stop to meet the others.

[[Continue|FlashbackConfession_OVER]]

passages.name: FlashbackConfession_OVER
passages.text:
The memory made your condition worse that your heart feels hollow inside. Your mouth hurts from crying already that remembering the sweet memory didn't help. It's almost time to get ready, so you quietly go into Kaylee's room and grab your suitcase to pick what clothes to wear. Dressing cute usually cheered you up, but right now it had no effect. 

Wondering what you are going to do today, you finish cleaning up and go on your phone to wait until Kaylee and her father were finished cleaning up.

//I'll just do my best to get my mind off of things. Maybe sleep in the car. I mean, sleep can definitely help, right?//

[[Continue|After_Flashback_Confession]]

passages.name: AfterFacebookScrolling
DatingSimRoute
passages.text:
Before you know it, you caught up with all of your stories and ended up purchasing more. "I can't believe I forgot how fun these used to be."

You find yourself getting into each story as if you're a part of them. You are not actually distracted, but at least you stopped crying for a bit. 
//I used to wish that my future boyfriend did these things, but even in a relationship, I find myself still wishing for these things. Cute.//

After catching up, you decided to go on Facebook to check up on the latest news.

[[Continue|Facebook_App]]

passages.name: After_Flashback_Confession
passages.text:
As you are in the car, Kaylee's father turns the radio up. Your neutral demeanor twists into salt and sadness as you realize that the current song playing was a love song. 
//I can't believe this is happening. I usually enjoy listening to love songs.//
Trying to not listen to the song, you grab your earphones and scrol through your phone to find an instrumental music to calm yourself.
"There we go."
"Hm?" your friend Kaylee asks you.
"Oh, nothing. Just mumbling to myself" you embarrassingly reply, with your ears turning slight red.
"Weirdo."

[[Continue|Weirdo]]

passages.name: Weirdo
passages.text:
You fall in a deep sleep by the lack of sleep and the calming music. As you become knocked out, you start to relive the devastating experience that corrupted and make you miserable in the first place.

"I'm sorry, so sorry. I'm sorry you had to find out this way, Tammi." You faintly hear a male's voice echoing in the distance. All you hear is sobbing on the other end.
//Is that me?//
"I can't- I can't believe you did this to me! Of all days, after all this time, I find out //now//!" The woman, presumably you, stops sobbing and you can barely hear every word, but since you know what you are remembering, you can fill in the blanks.
//Why? Why can't I just forget about this?//
"I didn't know how to tell you." You hear a man starting to cry, hiccupping as he speaks.

[[Continue|Weirdo_2]]

passages.name: Weirdo_2
Done_1
passages.text:
Replay? If not, exit the game.

[[Yes|Start]]

passages.name: Darn_It
passages.text:
You grab your phone but avert your eyes from the message. You quickly swipe the message away on the lock screen and go back to the room.

[[Continue|back_to_kayleeRoom]]

passages.name: Flashback_Num_2-2
